alert.note: Alert for Edgefield; McCormick (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 12 at 3:01AM EST until February 14 at 4:41AM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Columbia SC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Carolina... Stevens Creek Near Modoc affecting Edgefield and McCormick Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stevens Creek Near Modoc. * WHEN...From this morning to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Farmland along Stevens Creek above the US Highway 23 bridge near Modoc becomes flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM EST Sunday the stage was 13.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 21.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 315 PM EST.
